summary: The Medicare and Social Security Fair Share Act (S. 1690) aims to increase funding for Social Security and Medicare through several modifications to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Key provisions include: raising the wage base subject to Social Security taxes, introducing an additional hospital insurance tax on high-income earners on both wages and self-employment income, modifying the tax on net investment income, and allocating a portion of the increased tax revenue to the Old-Age and Survivors, Disability Insurance, and Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Funds. The changes primarily impact high-income taxpayers and are effective on or after January 1, 2026.
